WorkItem.Description: Any chance Rawr will ever be split into Rawr Lite versions? I am thinking like Rawr Lite: DPS DK or Rawr Lite: Arcane Mage. It would be totally awesome if I could get only the functionality I need without getting the classes I don't need.

Comments.Message:
Uh... what?

Well, the answer is no, but I'm more curious what you were thinking. What is the 'downside' you perceive about it including classes you don't need? (There's isn't one, beyond a tiny bit of download time or something, but I want to know why you'd think that there was, so perhaps we can improve the UI somehow)

It seems when Rawr first loads and I click Arcane Mage, then I'm waiting for about a minute while the program loads what it needs. I suppose it could be my laptop is a P.O.S., but not knowing about computer programming, I assume the program isn't loading everything mage-related when the application is first started. I just saw that Rawr 3 is going to be browser-based, so maybe this will solve my issues with load time.

Sorry for the neglect to commend the authors with an excellent program. I love Rawr because it's my number one tool for improving my character and the first place I turn.
Taking the models out wouldn't change anything, you might be starting in the Mage model but swapping to DPSDK back and forth would yield the same times you see now.
